Class AdministratorActions

java.lang.Object
AdministratorActions
public class AdministratorActions extends Object
AdministratorActions is a class that provides administrative functionalities for managing events. Administrators can create new events, inquire about events by ID or name, and view a list of all events. This class logs administrative actions to a text file.
Since:
November 19, 2023

  • Constructor Details

    • AdministratorActions

      public AdministratorActions()

  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      public static void createEvent(List<Event> events, Scanner keyboard)
      createEvent allows administrators to create a new event by providing various details such as event name, type, date, time, venue, ticket prices, and more. If the event is successfully created, it is added to the list of events. Administrative actions are logged into a text file.
      Parameters:
      events - A list of events where the new event will be added.
      keyboard - A Scanner object for reading user input.

    • askForFireworks

      public static boolean askForFireworks(Scanner keyboard)
      Asks the user whether fireworks will be planned for an event. The method displays a prompt and reads the user's response from the provided `Scanner` object. It returns `true` if the response is "yes" (case-insensitive), indicating that fireworks are planned, or `false` otherwise.
      Parameters:
      keyboard - A `Scanner` object for reading the user's response.
      Returns:
      `true` if fireworks are planned; otherwise, `false`.

    • userAdmin

      public static void userAdmin(List<Event> events, List<Customer> customers, Scanner keyboard)
      The `userAdmin` method provides an administrative menu for querying event information. It allows administrators to inquire events by ID or name and view a list of all events. The method logs administrative actions to a text file.
      Parameters:
      events - A list of events to be queried.
      keyboard - A `Scanner` object for reading user input.

    • inquireId

      public static void inquireId(List<Event> data, int eventId)
      The `inquireId` method allows administrators to inquire an event by its unique ID. If a matching event is found in the provided list of events, its details are printed. Otherwise, it indicates that the ID is not in the database.
      Parameters:
      data - A list of events to search for the event by ID.
      eventId - The ID of the event to be inquired.

    • inquireByname

      public static void inquireByname(List<Event> data, String eventName)
      The `inquireByname` method allows administrators to inquire an event by its name. If a matching event is found in the provided list of events, its details are printed. Otherwise, it indicates that the name is not in the database.
      Parameters:
      data - A list of events to search for the event by name.
      eventName - The name of the event to be inquired.

    • printAllEvents

      public static void printAllEvents(List<Event> data)
      Prints the details of all events in the specified list in ascending order based on their event ID.
      Parameters:
      data - The list of events to be printed.

    • profitAllEvents

      public static void profitAllEvents(List<Event> data)
      Calculates and prints the profit generated by each event in the given list. The profit is calculated based on the difference between the total revenue and the expected profit.
      Parameters:
      data - A list of events for which profit needs to be calculated.

    • profitIdEvent

      public static void profitIdEvent(List<Event> data, int eventId)
      Calculates and displays the profit generated by a specific event identified by its event ID. If the event ID is not found in the database, an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      data - The list of events in the database.
      eventId - The ID of the event for which profit is calculated and displayed.

    • createInvoice

      public static void createInvoice(List<Customer> customers)
      Allows the generation of invoice summaries for customers based on their usernames. The method prompts the user to enter the username of the customer for whom an invoice summary is to be generated. If a matching username is found in the list of customers, an invoice summary is generated and displayed. The process can be repeated for multiple customers until the user chooses to exit.
      Parameters:
      customers - A list of Customer objects representing the pool of customers.

    • getEventById

      public static Event getEventById(List<Event> events, int eventID)
      Retrieves an event based on its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      events - A list of events to search for the event by ID.
      eventID - The ID of the event to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The event with the specified ID, or null if not found.

    • cancelEvent

      public static void cancelEvent(List<Event> events, int eventId, List<Customer> customers)
      Cancels an event with the specified ID. If the event is found in the list of events, it is removed.
      Parameters:
      events - A list of events where the event will be canceled.
      eventId - The ID of the event to be canceled.
